alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Grant; Hot Spring; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 10 at 2:34PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Flood watch in effect for portions of Arkansas thru Thursday Afternoon... .Two upper level systems will move thru the area this afternoon thru Thursday. Persistent heavy rainfall associated with these systems will cause excessive rainfall across portions of southwest and south-central Arkansas which could lead to flash flooding. Rainfall amounts in excess of three inches could occur in some areas. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Little Rock has expanded the * Flood Watch to include portions of central Arkansas, southwest Arkansas, and western Arkansas, including the following areas, in central Arkansas, Garland, Grant, and Saline. In southwest Arkansas, Hot Spring. In western Arkansas, Central and Eastern Montgomery County, Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations, and Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations. * Through Thursday afternoon * WHEN...From 1 PM CDT this afternoon through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Grant; Hot Spring; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations
